description:
Consumption of spirits

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
73441 Statistics of spirits monopoly and spirits tax

Definition:
The consumption of spirits is calculated based on the
quantity on which tax was paid, minus tax relief.
For tax purposes, spirits are products classified under
1. Combined Nomenclature headings 2207 and 2208 (mainly
ethyl alcohol, liqueurs and other spirituous beverages) with
an alcoholic strength by volume exceeding 1.2% vol;
2. Combined Nomenclature headings 2204, 2205 and 2206
(mainly wine, vermouth and other fermented beverages) with
an alcoholic strength by volume exceeding 22% vol.
For tax purposes, spirituous products are alcoholic products
other than those listed in chapter 22 of the Combined
Nomenclature. They are produced using spirit or contain
spirit, and their alcoholic strength by volume exceeds 1.2%
vol or, in the case of non-liquid products, their alcoholic
strength by mass exceeds 1% mas.
